TopicTitle: [1.8-1.12] Kethane Plugin and Parts 0.11.0 - Now with background scanning.

Articles.Content: The shader is in kethane-*.ksp: delete the two that are not relevant for your platform. BTW, works fine here because I use Linux and kethane-linux.ksp gets loaded first and thus the right shader gets loaded

1 hour ago, taniwha said:

The shader is in kethane-*.ksp: delete the two that are not relevant for your platform. BTW, works fine here because I use Linux and kethane-linux.ksp gets loaded first and thus the right shader gets loaded

OMG I LOVE YOU!!!! No more pink everything! My eyes have stopped bleeding!

Thanks!

OMG I thought Kethane was so dead that I'd stopped checking on it!
I'm so pleased to see that it's back (and apparently has been for a while now). As others have said, this was one of the first ever mods I started using and it actually makes ISRU fun! The parts are aesthetically so much nicer (and I just love the particle effects), the scanning process is more engaging and sensible, and mining doesn't take eons! Thanks for bringing this back @taniwha!! 

Are there any plans to add kethane mining to asteroids?

Rumors of Kethane's death are greatly exaggerated.

Kethane (and other resource) mining on asteroids is something I've had planned for about two years, but never had the time to do.

I've heard about this but have only just actually looked into it. I may have to download... 

Can you please add some pics or a link to an infuriating album please? I would like to see what the parts look like.

10 minutes ago, Benji13 said:

I've heard about this but have only just actually looked into it. I may have to download... 

Can you please add some pics or a link to an infuriating album please? I would like to see what the parts look like. 

It would likely be less effort to simply download the mod and look at the parts yourself. Then @taniwha would have more time to actually work on creating cool new things.

is there another download link I'm missing?

Edited December 7, 2016 by al9984
Download link working now

Is this still being worked on? Not that I am expecting certain new features or anything but I am just surprised that no one seems to be talking about this mod.

When I first started playing 2 years ago this mod was huge and everybody was talking about it. Now I wanted to check YouTube for a tutorial / gameplay video on the new version and no one seems to bother. I have been abscent from the game and community for a while now, can someone explain?

Thanks :)!

1 hour ago, Milky said:

Is this still being worked on? Not that I am expecting certain new features or anything but I am just surprised that no one seems to be talking about this mod.

When I first started playing 2 years ago this mod was huge and everybody was talking about it. Now I wanted to check YouTube for a tutorial / gameplay video on the new version and no one seems to bother. I have been abscent from the game and community for a while now, can someone explain?

Thanks :)!

Milky,

I see this is your first post on the forums, but did you read up at all before posting?  The maintainer of this mod posted a mere 5 posts above and only a few weeks ago

Quote

Rumors of Kethane's death are greatly exaggerated.

The mod is updated to work with 1.2.  So the short answer is yes, it is still being worked on.

 

This mod was all the rage in its day because IIRC it was the first mining/resource mod for KSP.  It is now overshadowed by the fact that mining is a stock part of KSP now.

15 hours ago, goldenpsp said:

Milky,

I see this is your first post on the forums, but did you read up at all before posting?  The maintainer of this mod posted a mere 5 posts above and only a few weeks ago

The mod is updated to work with 1.2.  So the short answer is yes, it is still being worked on.

 

This mod was all the rage in its day because IIRC it was the first mining/resource mod for KSP.  It is now overshadowed by the fact that mining is a stock part of KSP now.

I did read the rest of the thread and now that you mention it, my initial question was a bit confusing and misleading. I knew there was someone who still works on this, I was just surprised that this didn't get more attention and figured that something might be wrong with the mod. 

I didn't know that Kethane or something similar is now actually a stock part of KSP, I will have to read up on that. Thank you for your quick reply!
Does anyone have a compiled version of 9.7?

9 hours ago, Probus said:

Does anyone have a compiled version of 9.7?

Do you mean aside from the download link in the first post?
I must have been clicking on the source code link.  Duh.  Thanks @goldenpsp
Aren't older versions of the mod kept anywhere?
Some, but I can vouch for only those that I released: just edit the download url to have the appropriate version number.

here is the problem, I'm not that familiar with your mod's working system yet, I'm afraid if I do something, I would break the balance that you worked on so much time to maintain

Excuse me my English. I am from Russia. But... I have some problems with this mod and KSP 1.2.2. The grid is pink! And it doesn't show any resources. What must I do whit it? Is there KETHANE for 1.2.2 version? Or how can I solve this problem? Please,  help me! And excuse my English)
@Ainor: I assume you are using windows or mac. There are three assemblies (one each for linux, mac and windows): delete the two that are not for your platform. That should fix the problem.

I've released version 0.9.8 of Kethane for KSP 1.2.2.

The main change from 0.9.7 is the tutorial works again.

When running only this mod on an otherwise modless install of KSP v1.2.2 for Windows x64, in the TrackingCenter, enabling the geodesic grid overlay produces a magenta hex-mesh on all focused planets, but not on any unfocused planet.  Undisplaying the geodesic grid allows for the magenta to disappear and the normal planet texture to become visible again.

Again, this happens on an otherwise unmodded install, Windows x64, with Kethane v0.9.8 (re-downloaded and re-tested to make sure.)

Logs and screen grabs are available here.

I'm rather convinced that I'm the one who's doing something wrong, but I can't seem to figure out what.  Any advice would be appreciated.

25 minutes ago, MisterFister said:

Did you read up?

57 minutes ago, goldenpsp said:

Did you read up?

Well slap me around and call me a doomed kerbal.  I thought I had but I obviously missed that.

That would be very helpful if it were more prominently explained in a readme file.

Separately from a readme, perhaps @taniwha could consider adding a .version to the file to allow for easier AVC / CKAN updates?  (And with respect to CKAN, perhaps the NetKan maintainers could include a sub-selection on shader needs would also help reduce user error in installation -- I think I'll bring this to their attention.)
